dt: {bc}any of various usually large birds of prey (such as the turkey vulture)

et: Middle English {it}busard{/it}, from Old French, alteration of {it}buison{/it}, from Latin {it}buteon, buteo{/it} hawk
shortdef: any of various usually large birds of prey (such as the turkey vulture)

dt: {bc}a large circumpolar arctic hawk ({it}Buteo lagopus{/it}) that winters southward and typically has a white tail with a wide black band or bands at the tip
Rough-legged hawks hover in the air on beating wings to search tundra, marshes, and fields for rodents to prey on.

shortdef: a large circumpolar arctic hawk (Buteo lagopus) that winters southward and typically has a white tail with a wide black band or bands at the tip

dt: {bc}an American vulture ({it}Cathartes aura{/it}) with a red head and whitish bill

shortdef: an American vulture (Cathartes aura) with a red head and whitish bill —called also turkey buzzard
